intro: Oxytropis korabensis, commonly known as the Korab locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Balkan Peninsula, particularly found in Albania, Kosovo, and northern Greece. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it often grows in rocky or dry habitats. Oxytropis korabensis is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in local ecosystems despite its toxic properties.
